titles.title: A resolution supporting efforts for increased healthy living for childhood cancer survivors.
A resolution supporting efforts for increased healthy living for childhood cancer survivors.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary: Calls for the U.S government to: (1) support neuropsychological research and testing of childhood cancer survivors and their families; (2) work with health care providers, educators, and childhood cancer advocacy and education organizations to encourage such testing; (3) reaffirm the U.S. commitment to fighting childhood cancer by promoting awareness about its causes, risks, prevention, and treatment; (4) promote new education programs about, research of, and expanded medical treatment for childhood cancer survivors; (5) support research and expanded public-private partnerships to improve post-cancer life for survivors; and (6) encourage early diagnosis and access to high-quality care for childhood cancer patients and survivors.
